title: Sun - February 1999 (gnv64)
description:
Sun - February 1999
English | PDF | 112 pages | 18.5 mb
scanned to PDF by me.

This was an old Indian monthly entertainment magazine which had undergone transformation from tabloid format to regular magazine format. Its has ceased publication now. I have scanned an old copy of mine & sharing it here for those few who may be interested!

FEATURES
EARLY BURNOUT
Today's youth are all keyed up on career and ruthless about professional and materialistic achievements. However, the sense of achievement too fizzles out soon...10
DIVYA PALAT: BORN TO BE A STAR
The Stanford University student has created ripples in the film industry by bagging David Dhawan's Chal Mere Bhai opposite Salman Khan, Sanjay Dutt and Karisma Kapoor. Watch out for her! 18
THE DATING GAME
It is temporary contact. It is romantic daring. It is subtle sparring. It is the game the young of the day play. A SUN exclusive 30
YOU CAN BE A FASHION DESIGNER
The fashion industry in India has opened up new vistas to young aspirants yearning to be fashion designers. A SUN guide. 40
HINDU COLLEGE
Hundred and Still Going Strong, Delhi's second oldest college is proud of its role in the Freedom Struggle. 57
BANGALORE GIRL'S SUICIDE
Arya Somarajan, a student of the city's Rajiv Gandhi Dental College, commits suicide due to harassment for fees. 59
THE YEAR AHEAD '99
Astrologer Ajay Bhambi predicts what's in store for you in 1999. 64
YOU CAN WIN
Shiv Khera's book on self-improvement is admittedly derivative, eloquently argued with the themes and topics discussed by a sharp mind. 74
ENTERTAINMENT '99
A preview of some notable Hindi and English films which will hit the screen. 80
